column2: title=A New Glossary of the Dialect of the Huddersfield District
image=[[Image:A New Glossary of the Dialect of the Huddersfield District.png

column1: '''''A New Glossary of the Dialect of the Huddersfield District''''' is a [[1928]] reference book of the dialect of [[Wikipedia:Huddersfield
column2: Huddersfield]]. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] contributed with a six page [[Foreword to A New Glossary of the Dialect of the Huddersfield District
column6: articlename=New Glossary of the Dialect of the Huddersfield District. 1928

column1: In his preface, Haigh thanks Tolkien: "''In the first place, I would sincerely thank Professor J.R.R. Tolkien, formerly Professor in [[University of Leeds
column2: Leeds University]], now Professor of [[Old English
column4: Oxford]]. Not only has he almost from the first shown his warm approval of the work, and befriended me with ever-ready advice and encouragement throughout, but he has also generously contributed a valuable Foreword to the Glossary.''"<ref name=TB/>

column1: *<small>[[Janet Brennan Croft]]: "Walter E. Haigh, Author of ''A New Glossary of the Huddersfield Dialect''", in [[Tolkien Studies: Volume 4
{{DEFAULTSORT:New Glossary of the Dialect of the Huddersfield District, A}}
